question.question_title: Field Level Encryption of Data jpa
question.question_text: I am able to achieve field level encryption of data using converter. But it is applicable for entities only. Not applicable in JPA repository. For example, I have a requirement to search with that sensitive data using JPARepository like findBySensitiveColumn. Apparently that is not encrypted, so it cannot search in the database with the plain text. If i try to use the same encryption used in side the converter, it gives me different value, ending up on mismatch with database. I know this could be the repeated question. But i tried encryption listener too. But it doesnt work. pls help

question.question_title: Android Java - Get Text from element with Accessibility Service
question.question_text:
I need to use an accessibility service to find out what text exists on an element when it appears.
The element I am targeting is an uber driver request, I currently am able to run code when a request appears by targeting it's element ID in accessibility services api.
I am detecting the presence of the request using this code:
AccessibilityNodeInfo nodeInfo = accessibilityEvent.getSource();
    List<AccessibilityNodeInfo> objectList = info.findAccessibilityNodeInfosByViewId("com.ubercab.driver:id/basic_info_left_label_container");
        if (objectList.size() > 0) {
              // Object is present. We now need to get text on that object
        }

Link to sample image of uber request
In the above image I would need to extract 3 strings.
They should be as follows:

"UberXL"
"4 min"
"4.83"

These strings will allow me to write code and make decisions on behalf of the user.
I have been searching for a solution for my problem for 3 days and have had no luck, I do not manage the app that I am trying to use accessibility services on, so as far as I am aware I am on the right track.
I have attempted to use the .getText() method of NodeInfo but it doesn't return anything of value.
How do I extract the text from these requests?

question.question_title: Advice for an asynchronous programming problem in Java

question_comments.text: I work with Java Swing, so I'm used to the idea of an ActionListener being invoked when a user left-clicks on a JButton.  You could create your own EventListener for the callback method.  Here's an article I wrote about EventListeners.
question_comments.author: Gilbert Le Blanc

all_answers.text:
I'd spend some time looking around in java.util.concurrent. Can't you just use an ExecutorService for a lot of this? You can submit() Callable code and get a future back, you can submit a list of Callables and give a timeout, you can call shutdown() and then awaitTermination() to wait for the processing to stop. You can get these notification callbacks by just submitting a Callable that constructs with the callback interface and invokes it when it feelsl like it's done.
Failing this, you might look at actors. Your concurrency pattern would likely be very easy in the actor model.
all_answers.author: Jon

question.question_title: When play framework create new instance of controller?
How to get cookies from sharedpreferences and set into WebView on Android Java?
question.question_text:
Now I am using OKhttp3 and PersistentCookieJar to get cookies when user loggin and save the cookies into a sharedpreferences file which provided by PersistentCookieJar.
But now when I want to open a new Webview Activity, the webview cannot load any cookies from that file so it will need user to login again.
I searched so many information about this but cannot find a worked answer, is there anyway I can get the cookies from sharedPreferences file and set into WebView?

question_comments.text: have you tried cookie manager see this
question_comments.author: aryan agarwal

question.question_title: Why I install rake assets:precompile and get the error?
question.question_text:
I use this command to install openADR from this https://github.com/epri-dev/OpenADR-Virtual-Top-Node.
 rake assets:precompile

When I run this I got this problem
rake aborted!
LoadError: cannot load such file -- java
/home/torquebox/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.7.0/gems/jdbc-postgresql-9.2.1000/lib/jdbc-postgresql.rb:2:in `require'
/home/torquebox/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.7.0/gems/jdbc-postgresql-9.2.1000/lib/jdbc-postgresql.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
/home/torquebox/oadr/config/application.rb:199:in `<top (required)>'
/home/torquebox/oadr/Rakefile:5:in `<top (required)>'
/home/torquebox/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.7.0/gems/rake-13.0.1/exe/rake:27:in `<top (required)>'
(See full trace by running task with --trace)

How I solve this problem because the program that I use require the old dependencies because the program it was create in 4 -5 years ago. But I need to use it!! This program bases on ruby on rails and also torquebox too. So, If I can't solve this problem, I can't run torquebox.
Thank for help
